text:
After a restart of Tomcat and the first time I try to access a jsp page I get
the following error:
org.apache.jasper.JasperException: /jsp/tabs.jsp(50,0) Unable to load tag
handler class "org.apache.struts.taglib.html.FormTag" for tag "html:form"
After I received the error I try the page again and this time it works.

Solution, I put struts.jar in $TOMCAT_HOME/common/lib and have not seen the
error since. But I would prefer to have struts.jar in my webapp.
creator: urban.lindberg@systech.se

text:
I never got the problem with the admin webapp, which uses Struts (and form tags,
obviously). Please submit a test case.
creator: remm@apache.org
urban.lindberg@systech.se
text:
I have trouble generating a test case.
The error happens within a big/complex application. I have noticed the error in
four seperate jsp pages. I tried to see what they had in common. And the only
thing I notice is the use of custom tags, but hen there exist more jsp pages
that use the same custom tags... so I'm lost.

It feels more like a timing problem, that the classes in the webapps WEB-INF/lib
has not been loaded yet...

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
The admin webapp is also rather big, and not really simple either, but it is
precompiled as servlets. Meybe this is the difference.

You didn't mention everything in your comments: does the problem occurs all the
time with the same pages ?, the stack trace, do you precompile your pages ? etc.
Witout a test case, I see no way to investigate this further.

(the explanation you proposed doesn't seem likely at this point, or the problems
would very likely occur for other things, not just with JSPs and tag handlers)

FYI:
Tried 5.0.24 and at first I could not repeat the error, but then I noticed a
difference, in my 5.0.19 installation I had unpackwars=false, when I for 5.0.24
added unpackwars=false I could again repeat the error also for 5.0.24.
So there is a clue.

I do not precompile.

I can reproduce the error on the same jsp page:
- Build a new WAR
- Restart tomcat-
- Access a specific jsp page. 
- And apparanetly unpackwars needs to be false
creator: urban.lindberg@systech.se
